articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The plan seen by Reuters includes sending aid to Gaza as soon as Hamas signs off on the ceasefire agreement.
articles.title: US proposes 60-day ceasefire for Gaza, plan shows

articles.author: Christian Lowe, Dmitry Antonov
articles.description: Ukraine resisted pressure from Moscow and Washington to commit itself to attending peace talks with Russia on June 2, saying it first needed to see the proposals Russian negotiators plan to bring to the talks.
articles.title: Ukraine keeps Russia guessing over participation in June 2 peace talks

articles.author: Francois Murphy, John Irish
articles.description: Western powers are preparing to push the U.N. nuclear watchdog's board at its next quarterly meeting to declare Iran in breach of its non-proliferation obligations for the first time in almost 20 years, a move bound to enrage Tehran, diplomats said.
articles.title: Exclusive: West plans to push IAEA board to find Iran in breach of duties, diplomats say

articles.author: Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth warned on Saturday that the threat from China was real and potentially imminent as he pushed allies in the Indo-Pacific to spend more on their own defence needs.
articles.title: Pentagon chief warns of imminent China threat, pushes Asian allies to hike defence spending

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's interior minister is hoping the European Union can reach a bloc-wide agreement on sending failed asylum seekers who cannot go home to safe countries near their original homelands.
articles.title: Germany hopes for EU deal on sending failed asylum seekers to third countries, minister says

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The situation in Gaza is the worst since the war between Israel and Hamas militants began 19-months ago, the United Nations said on Friday, despite a resumption of limited aid deliveries in the Palestinian enclave where famine looms.
articles.title: Conditions in Gaza are catastrophic despite renewed aid, UN says

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The move bolsters the Republican president's drive to step up deportations.
articles.title: US Supreme Court lets Trump revoke 'parole' status for migrants

articles.author: Sofia Menchu
articles.description: A top Guatemalan court on Friday sentenced three former paramilitaries each to 40 years in prison after they were found guilty of raping six Indigenous women between 1981 and 1983, the bloodiest period of the Central American nation's civil war.
articles.title: Guatemalan ex-paramilitaries sentenced to 40 years each in Maya Achi rape trial

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: When the Trump administration cut federal funding to Harvard University, it abruptly ended an estimated $180 million that the federal government had poured into U.S. military projects at Harvard in recent years, according to an analysis from a defense software company.
articles.title: Harvard's US-funded defense projects totaled $180 million in recent years, study shows

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that billionaire Elon Musk will remain a close adviser, even after the Tesla CEO departs the administration following a chaotic four-month tenure that saw him disrupt dozens of agencies in his effort to slash government spending.
articles.title: Trump, Musk offer show of unity as Tesla CEO departs government
